results.title: Thatching
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, E. Lawrence Couter and Angus MacAskill
results.brief_description: The film details a process important to house-building in England and the early New England colonies. Using authentic tools and techniques, a seasoned worker at the Plimoth Plantation in Massachusetts thatches the roof of a newly constructed cottage. The film covers all steps, which usually takes one man from eight to ten weeks to complete.
results.creator_credit_for_label: International Film Bureau, E. Lawrence Couter and Angus MacAskill

results.title: That was rock: the TAMI/TNT Show
results.brief_description: Introduced and presented by Chuck Berry this video captures the essence of the sixties - the music, the dancing, the fashion and the culture. A wonderful trip down memory lane especially for the baby-boomers out there. Features magical performances by Chuck Berry, James Brown, Ray Charles and his Orchestra, Bo Diddley, Marvin Gaye, Gerry and the Pacemakers, Leslie Gore, Jan and Dean, Smokey Robinson and the Miracles, The Ronettes, The Rolling Stones, The Supremes, and Ike and Tina Turner and includes among the 37 songs, “Baby love” (The Supremes), “Time is on my side” (The Rolling Stones) and “You don’t own me” (Leslie Gore). Music directors - Jack Nitsche, Phil Spector.

results.title: That they may live
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, David Adams and Scott Peters
results.brief_description: Presents direct artificial respiration, showing that mouth-to-mouth breathing is the best method being easier, more efficient and so simple children can learn it. Demonstrates the steps involved and illustrates its value with a series of varied and dramatic incidents.

results.title: That our children will not die
results.brief_description: Nigeria has the highest death rate in the world. 90% of children die from preventable diseases - fever (malaria) convulsions, diarrhoea, vomiting, bronchopneumonia, measles and malnutrition. In mothers, the majority of deaths are related to pregnancy and child-bearing. Written in a feminist perspective, the film explores the subject of male dominance in the home and the re-education of both men and women in informed decision-making to help save children’s lives. The film also shows the primary health care services available in various parts of Nigeria which use specially trained community health workers in an expanded role. Discusses what needs to be the focus for any health-planning. Narrated by Professor O. Ransome-Kuti.

results.title: That mouse
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: A white mouse cavorts about the forest, mostly on the back of a bumbling black bear, creating such a stir that other forest creatures (a deer, a tortoise, a hawk and a hound) have to put a stop to it. Children will enjoy the way the animals speak with human voices and act out their parts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Michael Rubbo

results.title: That midnight kiss
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joe Pasternak and Norman Taurog
results.brief_description: An opera singer (Kathryn Grayson) would like to have a tenor who looks the part of the tenor role. When Lanza, a singing truck driver is discovered, she gets her wish - and a happy ending isn’t far away. Cast also includes Jose Iturbi, Ethel Barrymore, Keenan Wynn, J. Carrol Naish, Thomas Gomez.

results.title: That eye, the sky [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Entertainment Media, Working Title Films, Peter Beilby, Grainne Marmion and John Ruane
results.brief_description: When twelve-year-old Ort Flack’s father Sam is plunged into a coma after a truck accident, his family is fractured. As Ort’s mother bravely tries to hold her family together, a mysterious stranger appears and changes their lives - giving Ort courage, comfort and faith. This acclaimed adaptation of the novel by Tim Winton is about the healing power of love, about fantasy and faith, about a boy’s visions of the world beyond and about the blurry distinctions between the natural and the supernatural. Nominated for 9 AFI Awards and starring Peter Coyote, Lisa Harrow and Jamie Croft. Co-starring Amanda Douge, Mark Fairall and Alethea McGrath. Directed by John Ruane (Death in Brunswick), with music by David Bridie.

results.title: That all may learn
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: The human story of a Mexican farmer and his family, who are exploited because they cannot read or write, is used as a case to stress the need for education of all the peoples the world over. Unesco’s part in correcting these conditions is portrayed.
results.description: The human story of a Mexican farmer and his family, who are exploited because they cannot read or write, is used as a case to stress the need for education of all the peoples the world over. Unesco’s part in correcting these conditions is portrayed.
